title.narrative: Office of the Ombudsman's capacity for fulfilling its mandates and contributing to the reform agendas strengthened
Office of the Ombudsman's capacity for fulfilling its mandates and contributing to the reform agendas strengthened

target.value: OO specialists have not undergone comprehensive training either in analytical products development/evidence-based policy inputs production or in how to apply these in NHRI-appropriate advocacy with key duty-bearers and decision-makers; There is no plan for 2018 and onwards.

actual.value: 100% of OO regional network staff (15% of OO staff in general) have built skills in the following thematic areas: access to public information and personal data protection; M&E and application of a monitoring methodology; OO anti-discrimination activities; application of HRBA; NPM; Human rights protection in criminal proceedings; Protection of social and economic rights and IDPs rights. New Strategy up to 2020 was developed and adopted in February 2018.

target.value: Progress towards: • Preparation of evidence-based thematic reports by the Ombudsman and their quality assessed positively by national and international experts. • Training. mentoring and sensitization activities conducted by the Office of the Ombudsman for duty-bearers to be determined throughout start-up phase • Strategy for the Office of the Ombudsman for 2018 and onwards.

actual.value: The Ombudsman plays a significant and positive role in promotion and protection of human rights. Looking back on the events of the Maidan. the Ombudsman demonstrated ability to remain politically neutral while continuously monitoring and addressing the cases of violations closely. Stakeholders from both state institutions and civil society characterise the Ombudsperson to be professional. efficient and politically unbiased. A strong partnership with the Ombudsman has been developed and. in relation to the project. a number of good results was achieved both at the national and regional level. The Ombudsman is expressing sincere interest to provide further support too its de-centralised setup. with the aim of acquiring a regional coordinator (CSO representative) and a regional representative (civil servant) in each region.

target.value: • Number of Office of the Ombudsman specialists trained to be determined throughout start-up phase. • No fewer than 2 evidence-based thematic reports per year are produced by the Office of the Ombudsman and their quality assessed positively by national and international experts. • Exact number of training. mentoring and sensitization activities conducted by the the Office of the Ombudsman for duty-bearers to be determined throughout start-up phase • Strategy for the Office of the Ombudsman for 2018 and onwards adopted. - Exact target on the proportion of complaints to be determined and approved by the project board prior to immediate launch of the project.

actual.value: • Strategic Plan up to April 2017 approved. which identified 18 strategic goals • 3000 specialists received training (15% of the Office of the Ombudsman staff) – strategic planning. M&E. regional NPM. • 25 trainings. mentoring and sensitization activities by the Office of the Ombudsman for duty-bearers conducted (Minimal Standards of treatment in social sphere premises. access to public information and personal data protection. forensic psychiatric and prison mental health). 21 trainings on CPC implementation for judges. persecutors and lawyers (14 regions. almost 250 judges. 300 prosecutors and 250 lawyers). • Campaign on presentation of results and recommendations of the civic monitoring of access to public information among local authorities (15 regions. 850 copies).

target.value: - High-quality Office of the Ombudsman Communication Strategy and Action Plan with SMART goals is in place and being implemented. - Exact realistic increase rate in public awareness on the Office of the Ombudsman and its services is to be determined throughout the start-up phase. - Number of journalists in formal and informal networks nurtured by the development engagement reaches 250.

actual.value: National survey of human rights awareness undertaken with 2.002 respondents. 48.1% know/ heard about the work of the Office of the Ombudsman (nationwide survey 2016). 5.6 % generally in Ukraine and 21 % in Donbas believes that an application to the Office of the Ombudsman is an effective instrument of human rights protection in 2016 (in 2009 - 3.1% generally in Ukraine).

target.value: Degree of public awareness on the OO and its services against the verified baseline.

actual.value: Support to public awareness regarding human rights provided. Reached 56% (2018 Human Rights Baseline Study).

target.value: • National Human Rights Standards Action Plan implementation at 21% • Baseline assessment of human rights awareness launched • 2015 Office of the Ombudsman (OO) annual report (550-pages. 16 thematic sections); and 2015 Office of the Ombudsman annual report on National Preventative Mechanism. • Office of the Ombudsman regional network covers 24 regions (100 % of the country). Provides regional monitoring of National Preventative Mechanism against torture.

actual.value: 1. National Human Rights Strategy (adopted in 2015). with the Action Plan. provides a 5 year roadmap to address human rights issues and conflict-related challenges in 24 strategic areas. CSO monitoring platform reveals a 29% implementation rate. 2. Support to public awareness regarding human rights provided. Reached 56% (2018 Human Rights Baseline Study). 3. The OO incorporated Human Rights Baseline Study results into chapter 16 of the Annual Report 2018 to the Parliament. offering human rights-related data for their consideration and updating on general public’s perception of human rights situation. The study also guided the OO in the development of Strategic Plan up to 2020. The OO used the Progress Study results during the Forum “70th Anniversary of Universal Declaration of Human Rights” aimed to promote human rights agenda. 4. The OO regional network covers all 24 oblasts and includes 19 regional coordinators.
